author: news@irishmirror.ie (Niamh Spence)
title: Jedward treat Gemma Collins' mum to full blonde hair makeover
text:
Gemma Collins has treated her mum to a one of a kind hairdressing experience with friends Jedward as the pair perform a blonde at home makeover.
The Irish music twins have long been friends with the former
The Only Way Is Essex star since their time in Celebrity Big Brother, and it appears they've now brought Gemma's mum into the friendship too.
In a video on
Gemma didn't share the finished result with fans, leaving everyone guessing whether the twins hairdressing skills did the job for Joan. However Gemma has been sharing funny clips and videos to Instagram as Jedward stayed with her, fiancÃ© Rami Hawash and Gemma's family. In one clip on her social media, Gemma can be heard laughing as Jedward sing
Christmas songs and play a guitar in her garden surrounded by festive decorations.
The musical performers have previously opened up on their friendship with Gemma, as they praised her as "a solid person" in their lives. The pair revealed a bond with Gemma Collins in an exclusive chat to the Mirror as they revealed the star has a different side to what the public sees and that she kindly helped them when they moved to London recently.
Speaking to the Mirror, Jedward said: "Our friend Gemma [Collins] recently gave us her furniture, so we have some Barbie furniture in our spot. Gemma is such a vibe, such a solid person in our lives. We've known each other for a few years now. There's a lot more to Gemma, cos obviously everyone has this opinion of Gemma but she can get deep and she's had things happen in her life."
The festive get together comes just a few months after Jedward revealed they'd been the victim of a mugging. Former
X Factor star Edward Grimes has revealed that he was left 'shaken up' after an attempted mugging by masked attackers. Writing on
He added: "Felt my wrist and arm being grabbed from behind it all happened so fast and didnâ€™t have John next to me. Just would hate this to happen to anyone else and being made feel vulnerable."
Join the Irish Mirrorâ€™s breaking news service on WhatsApp. Click
this link to receive breaking news and the latest headlines direct to your phone. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you donâ€™t like our community, you can check out any time you like. If youâ€™re curious, you can read our Privacy Notice.

author: Brittany Miller
title: Teddi Mellencamp shares hopeful update on cancer after revealing her '50/50' odds of survival - NewsBreak
text: Teddi Mellencamp has given fans a new optimistic update on her cancer. The former Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star first received her melanoma diagnosis in 2022, which advanced to stage four in February and metastasized to her lungs and brain . She underwent major brain surgery in February that removed four tumors, more than doctors expected to find, Mellencamp revealed. Other hard-to-reach tumors couldnâ€™t be removed. Mellencamp turned to Instagram on Wednesday to share that all of her tumors have shrunken. â€œI have 6ish more weeks of immunotherapy, and doctors believe I will be healed if everything stays on course,â€ she wrote in the caption. Currently, she has only two more immunotherapy sessions left before â€œhopefully I am done and I will be cancer-free.â€ Immunotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses the bodyâ€™s immune system to fight the cancer. â€œI'm going to keep a positive outlook because that's the way my doctor just spoke to me. He's like, â€˜You did this, you got this,â€™â€ said the former reality television star. The news comes a week after she opened up about why she hasnâ€™t asked her doctors about her chances of survival during an interview with Nightline . â€œI learned this isnâ€™t the best question to ask if youâ€™re doing immunotherapy because immunotherapy has only been around 10 years,â€ she said. Mellencamp, however, has been given updates about how likely she is to live amid her cancer treatment. â€œOne of my favorite things to ask is, â€˜How long I got? What are my chances?â€ she continued. â€œAnd they oftentimes say, 50/50. [Iâ€™m like] â€˜50/50! I wouldnâ€™t buy a car thatâ€™s only gonna drive 50 percent chance of the time. I donâ€™t want this.â€™â€ She said her doctor clarified: â€œNo, itâ€™s only because thatâ€™s how long immunotherapy has been around, so thatâ€™s how long the study has worked.â€ Earlier in the interview, the reality star shared how the immunotherapy has taken a toll on her body. â€œI would say the hardest thing for me is Iâ€™ve always been a super active person, and, like, I cannot do the things I was used to doing,â€ she explained, before later noting that she could barely walk one mile when sheâ€™s â€œused to running seven milesâ€ a day. She also shared another reason why her cancer has been challenging, confessing: â€œI really like to have control, and this is completely out of my control. And for the first time, Iâ€™m really scared.â€ Last month, Mellencamp told her Instagram followers that yet more tumors were found in her body after doctors removed more tumors than they originally expected during her surgery. â€œUpdate from my scans today,â€ Mellencamp captioned an Instagram post with a photo of herself. â€œI have multiple tumors in my brain that werenâ€™t able to be removed via surgery. I also have two tumors in my lung. These are all metastases of my melanoma.â€ She has also opened up about how she talks to her young children about her cancer. Teddi and her estranged husband, Edwin Arroyave, share Slate, 12; Cruz, 10; and Dove, 5. â€œIâ€™m fighting for my life,â€ she said during an interview with Us Weekly . â€œBut also for my familyâ€™s life and all the people I love.â€

author: @todonoticias
title: Tragedia en CÃ³rdoba: un hombre muriÃ³ tras ser alcanzado por un rayo en medio de una tormenta | TN
text:
Un hombre muriÃ³ tras ser alcanzado por un rayo en medio de una feroz tormenta que azotÃ³ al norte de la provincia de CÃ³rdoba. El lamentable episodio ocurriÃ³ antes de las 23 de este jueves en el paraje rural llamado La Penca, cerca de la localidad de SebastiÃ¡n Elcano, a unos 170 kilÃ³metros de la capital provincial.
El temporal provocÃ³ voladuras y destrozos, pero la pÃ©rdida mÃ¡s grande fue la muerte del hombre de 60 aÃ±os que se encontraba a la intemperie junto a una enfermera que lo acompaÃ±aba, segÃºn informaron medios locales.
LeÃ© tambiÃ©n: CÃ³rdoba: hubo mÃ¡s de 50 intoxicados tras un evento en la Facultad de Arquitectura
De acuerdo a la informaciÃ³n publicada por el medio cordobÃ©s El Doce , la vÃ­ctima falleciÃ³ en el acto luego de ser alcanzado por el rayo . La profesional que estaba con Ã©l declarÃ³ que la causa de muerte habrÃ­a sido un infarto provocado por la intensa descarga elÃ©ctrica.
La mujer llamÃ³ inmediatamente al servicio de emergencias para dar aviso de lo ocurrido y una ambulancia se hizo presente en la vivienda del mencionado paraje. El personal mÃ©dico revisÃ³ al hombre pero sÃ³lo pudieron constatar el deceso .
El hecho es investigado por la Justicia y la causa quedÃ³ a cargo de la FiscalÃ­a de Dean Funes.
Otra tragedia en CÃ³rdoba: un hombre muriÃ³ electrocutado mientras arreglaba un lavarropas Un hombre muriÃ³ electrocutado mientras arreglaba un lavarropas. El trÃ¡gico hecho ocurriÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles en la localidad de Alta Gracia , en CÃ³rdoba.
El lugar donde ocurriÃ³ el lamentable episodio. (Foto: Facebook / Carmen Minniti) LeÃ© tambiÃ©n: La desapariciÃ³n de MarÃ­a Cash: rastrillaron la zona donde el camionero habrÃ­a descartado el cuerpo
El lamentable episodio se produjo durante la maÃ±ana en una casa del barrio Parque Virrey, de acuerdo a lo que informaron fuentes policiales. La vÃ­ctima tenÃ­a 45 aÃ±os.
Luego de un llamado al 911, un servicio de emergencias fue hasta la propiedad, segÃºn indicÃ³ El Doce . Sin embargo, los mÃ©dicos no pudieron hacer nada y confirmaron que la vÃ­ctima falleciÃ³ tras sufrir una descarga elÃ©ctrica.

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Marciapiede impraticabile per le erbacce  - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
Câ€™era una volta un marciapiede, ora trionfano le erbacce. Questa la situazione in via Vittorio Veneto allâ€™angolo con via Meucci a Sestu. Fioccano le proteste di chi abita qui o passa nella zona ed Ã¨ costretto a camminare in mezzo alla strada perchÃ© lâ€™area dedicata ai pedoni Ã¨ diventata una piccola foresta.
In questi giorni continua lo sfalcio ai lati dei marciapiedi in tutta la cittÃ  ma qui il lavoro Ã¨ complicato dal fatto che le erbacce vengono da un terreno privato, oltre la recinzione. Uno spazio praticamente incolto, in passato sede di un deposito di materiali edili ma da tempo non frequentato. Ma questa vegetazione potrebbe avere i giorni contati. Dalla prossima settimana molto probabilmente arriverÃ  unâ€™ordinanza, come gli anni scorsi, per far ripulire dalla vegetazione incolta tutti i terreni di privati. Sono previste anche sanzioni, a cura della Polizia Locale. Lo scopo Ã¨ evitare gli incendi, ma anche la viabilitÃ  ne trarrÃ  beneficio.

author: time news
title: UNRWA fears it will have to cease its activities â€œby the end of Februaryâ€ in Gaza - TIme News
text: 2024-02-01 19:58:27 Find here our situation update published yesterday A child holds a booklet as he waits inside a health center of the United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA) in the Palestinian refugee camp of Shatila, in the suburbs from Beirut, Lebanon, January 30, 2024. MOHAMED AZAKIR / REUTERS Efforts are intensifying towards a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas on Thursday, February 1, in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli fighting and raids continue, worsening the already disastrous humanitarian situation. US President Joe Biden has adopted an unprecedented measure aimed at sanctioning Israeli settlers accused of violence against Palestinians in the occupied West Bank, where violence has increased on the sidelines of the war in Gaza to, according to him, reach â€œintolerable levelsâ€. UNRWA says it risks having to cease its activities â€œby the end of Februaryâ€ The United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA) announced that it might have to close its doors â€œby the end of February, not only [dans la bande de] Gaza, but also throughout the region Â»after thirteen countries, including major donors, announced they were suspending their funding. â€œSpineâ€ aid to Gaza, according to the UN, UNRWA is accused by Israel of being â€œtotally infiltrated by Hamasâ€. Jordanian Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi, for his part, â€œstressed the immediate need for the international community to support UNRWAâ€. On the same day, Norwegian Labor MP Asmund Aukrust told the newspaper The daily newspaper having submitted UNRWAâ€™s candidacy for the Nobel Peace Prize â€œfor his long-term work in providing vital support to Palestine and the wider region.â€ In the devastated Palestinian enclave which has become Â« inhabitable Â»according to the United Nations, the population â€ starving â€œ et â€œis pushed to the brinkâ€according to the World Health Organization. The attack by the Palestinian Islamist movement on October 7, 2023 killed some 1,163 people, mostly civilians, according to a new count from Agence France-Presse based on official Israeli figures. In response, Israel vowed toâ€œannihilateâ€ Hamas, in power in Gaza since 2007, and launched a military offensive which left 27,019 dead, the vast majority civilians, according to the Hamas health ministry. Read the explanations | Article reserved for our subscribers UNRWA: who finances the United Nations agency dedicated to Palestinian refugees, today in turmoil? US sanctions Israeli settlers in West Bank US President Joe Biden has adopted an unprecedented measure aimed at sanctioning Israeli settlers accused of violence against Palestinians in the occupied West Bank, where violence has increased on the sidelines of the war in Gaza to, according to him, reach â€œintolerable levelsâ€. According to Washington, the sanctions target people accused ofÂ«acts of terrorismÂ» or who â€œundermine peace, stability and securityâ€ in the territory. Israel considered that there was no â€œno room for exceptional measuresâ€ against Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank, where violence has increased on the sidelines of the war in Gaza, after sanctions announced by Washington. The World Application The Morning of the World Every morning, find our selection of 20 articles not to be missed Download the app â€œThe absolute majority of the settlers of [Cisjordanie] are law-abiding citizens, many of whom are currently fighting in defense of Israel. Israel acts against all those who violate the law everywhere Â»said the office of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a statement. See also Former Philippine President Ramos has died World News | International News | Malayalam News Read the report | Article reserved for our subscribers West Bank: the other war led by Israel Qatar says Hamas sent positive signal on truce talks Hamas gave a â€œfirst positive confirmationâ€ to a proposed humanitarian pause in its war with Israel and an exchange of Palestinian hostages and prisoners, announced Majed Al-Ansari, spokesperson for Qatarâ€™s foreign ministry. â€œThis proposal was approved by the Israeli sideâ€he continued. This new agreement is based on a proposal made following a meeting in France last weekend between American, Israeli, Qatari and Egyptian representatives. â€œThe road ahead is still very difficult (â€¦) We hope that in the next two weeks we will be able to share some good news on this matterâ€added Mr. Al-Ansari. Hamas leader IsmaÃ¯l Haniyeh is expected in Egypt on Thursday or Friday to discuss a new cessation of fighting. According to a Hamas source, this is a proposal including a six-week truce during which Israel will release between 200 and 300 Palestinian prisoners in exchange for 35 to 40 hostages held in Gaza, and 200 to 300 aid trucks. will be able to enter the Palestinian territory every day. Some 250 people were kidnapped and taken to the Gaza Strip on the day of the Hamas attack, around a hundred of whom were released at the end of November during a first truce, in exchange for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel. According to Israeli authorities, 105 hostages remain detained and alive in Gaza, and 27 others have been declared dead by the army. Hamas brigade in Khan Younis â€œdismantledâ€, according to Israel On Yoav Gallant, the Israeli defense minister, wrote that the Hamas brigade in Khan Yunis was â€œdismantledâ€. â€œWe are finalizing our missions in Khan YounÃ¨s. We will also reach Rafah and eliminate the terrorist elements that threaten usâ€he said of the city located at the southern tip of the Palestinian enclave, on the border with Egypt. Many Palestinian civilians fled to the south of the Gaza Strip and then to Rafah as the vast offensive launched by Israel in retaliation for the Hamas attack on October 7 expanded into the narrow coastal strip, densely populated. The Israeli army initially focused its bombings and ground operations in the north of the Palestinian enclave. After claiming to have taken control of the area, the Israeli army intensified its operations in southern Gaza, mainly in and around Khan Yunis. author: laprensa.com.ar
title: Ford inicia su Summer Experience 2025 con nuevas propuestas - Sobre Ruedas | Diario La Prensa
text:
Ford ya puso en marcha sus acciones de verano con nuevas propuestas para los principales balnearios de la costa atlÃ¡ntica argentina y uruguaya.
El Summer Experience de la marca del Ã³valo contarÃ¡ con test drives, clÃ­nicas de manejo off road y diferentes atracciones en Pinamar, CarilÃ³, Mar del Plata, Chapadmalal y Punta del Este.
CarilÃ³ y Pinamar
Desde este jueves y diciembre hasta el 4 de marzo, en el horario de 17 a 0, la esquina de Cerezo y avenida Divisadero, comienzan las actividades de verano en el tradicional stand de Ford.
AllÃ­, se exhibirÃ¡ la familia Raza Fuerte con la nueva generaciÃ³n de Ranger y la F-150 Tremor como protagonistas. TambiÃ©n estarÃ¡n presentes la Maverick, y la Ranger Raptor.
En otro sector se encontrarÃ¡n los SUV de Ford como Territory, Bronco Sport y la recientemente anunciada Everest como atracciÃ³n principal.
AdemÃ¡s, los visitantes podrÃ¡n conocer a otro de los vehÃ­culos lanzados este aÃ±o: la sÃ©ptima generaciÃ³n del Mustang GT.
En tanto, el Off-Road Campus de Pinamar Norte abrirÃ¡ sus puertas desde el 2 de enero y hasta el 16 de febrero, en el horario de 10 a 19.
Este espacio ubicado en PoseidÃ³n y avenida Libertador, Ford renueva las propuestas de su Raza Fuerte. AllÃ­, los interesados podrÃ¡n conocer la nueva Bronco Wildtrack que serÃ¡ testigo de los Test Drive de las pick-ups Raza Fuerte y de Bronco Sport. AdemÃ¡s, habrÃ¡ travesÃ­as nocturnas y clÃ­nicas de manejo off-road teÃ³rico-prÃ¡cticas.
En el stand, los clientes Ford podrÃ¡n acceder sin cargo al servicio de calibraciÃ³n de neumÃ¡ticos, para preparar su vehÃ­culo antes de ingresar a la zona de La Frontera.
Este aÃ±o, el espacio de Ford en Pinamar Norte ofrecerÃ¡ una novedad para los clientes de la marca. En su rooftop, los clientes de Ford podrÃ¡n usar un espacio de cowork al aire libre, equipado con sombrillas y wifi para aquellos que necesiten hacer una pausa en sus vacaciones para atender su trabajo o negocio.
Ford invita a sus clientes y aquellos interesados en participar de estas actividades e ingresar al sitio web de Ford Argentina para saber los dÃ­as y horarios disponibles e inscribirse en ellas.
Punta del Este â€“ Uruguay
El 2 de enero, Ford renueva su presencia en la costa uruguaya con la dÃ©cima ediciÃ³n del Herencia-Mustang Day Trip. Se trata del tradicional encuentro de riders, fanÃ¡ticos del Mustang y clientes de Ford que tendrÃ¡n la posibilidad de disfrutar de una caravana que partirÃ¡ desde JosÃ© Ignacio liderada por el Mustang GT, el Ãºltimo lanzamiento del icÃ³nico pony car en Argentina. Los clientes podrÃ¡n participar de esta actividad que culminarÃ¡ con un show de mÃºsica en vivo en el legendario local de La Barra.
A su vez, la marca del Ã³valo acompaÃ±arÃ¡ una vez mÃ¡s al reconocido DJ internacional HernÃ¡n CattÃ¡neo en su ya tradicional â€œSunsetStripâ€ con una propuesta inmersiva que combina innovaciÃ³n, atardecer y mÃºsica en La Susana, JosÃ© Ignacio, los dÃ­as 3 y 4 de enero de 2025.
AdemÃ¡s, durante todo enero los clientes de Ford -a travÃ©s de la aplicaciÃ³n Ford Pass- podrÃ¡n disfrutar de una propuesta gastronÃ³mica exclusiva en el restaurante â€œMostrador Santa Teresitaâ€, que ofrece comida de autor de la mano del reconocido chef argentino Fernando Trocca. Ford invita a los clientes a visitar la secciÃ³n â€œBeneficiosâ€ de la aplicaciÃ³n Ford Pass, una vez que estÃ©n en Punta del Este para poder acceder a esta invitaciÃ³n.
Mar del Plata y Chapadmalal
Las actividades de verano se extienden tambiÃ©n a Mar del Plata y Chapadmalal, sumando una importante cuota de deporte al Ford Summer Experience 2025. Por un lado, los fanÃ¡ticos del golf tendrÃ¡n la posibilidad de vivir la ediciÃ³n 105Â° del Abierto del Sur, uno de los torneos mÃ¡s tradicionales y prestigiosos de Argentina. El mismo se disputarÃ¡ en el histÃ³rico Mar del Plata Golf Club del 22 al 26 de enero, abriendo asÃ­ la temporada de golf del 2025.
Por otro lado, al sur de Mar del Plata, Ford acompaÃ±arÃ¡ una vez mÃ¡s a los surfistas en Chapadmalal. El 14 de enero, Ford presentarÃ¡ â€œMÃ¡s Aloha por Favorâ€, una jornada diseÃ±ada por mujeres y para mujeres, con actividades de yoga, arte y surf que se llevarÃ¡ a cabo en el balneario â€œLuna Rojaâ€. Del 12 al 14 de enero nuevamente Ford presentarÃ¡ el campeonato de surf â€œQuiksilver Full moon sessionsâ€, en el balneario Chapatrapa, y del 23 al 26 tendrÃ¡ lugar el primer campeonato de surf RVCA en SudamÃ©rica, tambiÃ©n presentado por Ford Argentina, el mismo sucederÃ¡ en Playa Chapadmalal Hotel 10.
FORDi, Ford Pass y Ford Go
Los visitantes que se acerquen a los espacios de CarilÃ³ y Pinamar, estarÃ¡n acompaÃ±ados de FORDi, el asistente virtual de Ford, que los guiarÃ¡ y brindarÃ¡ informaciÃ³n acerca de cada vehÃ­culo exhibido, productos, cotizaciÃ³n de vehÃ­culos, servicios de posventa e incluso sobre las actividades del verano, contando con la posibilidad de reservar una prueba de manejo.
Ford invita a sus clientes que se encuentren en estas locaciones a descargar y utilizar la aplicaciÃ³n Ford Pass, y a estar atentos a las redes sociales, para conocer mÃ¡s acerca de los beneficios disponibles este verano.
Con propuestas como las que se llevarÃ¡n adelante en los espacios de Pinamar y CarilÃ³, las experiencias en Punta del Este y las actividades deportivas en Mar del Plata y Chapadmalal, Ford reafirma su compromiso por estar mÃ¡s cerca de sus clientes haciÃ©ndolos protagonistas de experiencias disruptivas en cada contacto con ellos, en este caso acompaÃ±Ã¡ndolos en los destinos turÃ­sticos mÃ¡s concurridos durante la temporada de verano 2025.

author: Catharina Cheung
title: July 2024 in Hong Kong reported as â€˜exceptionally hotâ€™
text:
Weâ€™re still in the thick of summer in Hong Kong â€“ for more than a month now, citizens have been grappling with soaring temperatures, heavy downpours, and the ever-looming threat of typhoons. If you thought this summer has been particularly brutal, youâ€™re not weak or imagining it. The Hong Kong Observatory (HKO) has confirmed that weâ€™ve just experienced an â€˜exceptionally hotâ€™ July this year.
A subtropical ridge thatâ€™s stronger than usual has dominated over southern China for the majority of July, causing the monthly mean air temperature to be one degree Celsius higher than usual at 29.9, and the monthly rainfall to be 19 percent above the norm at 458.5 millimetres. The very hot weather warning was in place for 18 days of last month. The hottest day proved to be July 7, with temperatures at HKO rising to a maximum of 34.8 degrees Celsius, though temperatures on July 7 and 10 did also exceed 35 degrees Celsius in some locations.
Mainland Chinese weather authorities have said that July was the countryâ€™s hottest month since records began in 1961. While temperatures can differ greatly across the countryâ€™s vast landmass, the mean temperature in every province was higher than the July average from previous years, with the provinces of Guizhou and Yunnan in southwestern China in particular recording their highest-ever averages.
To add to the scorching heat, there were also some areas of low pressure that intensified into tropical cyclones and depressions in the vicinity of Hong Kong, such as the tropical storm Prapiroon which moved across Hainan and then inland into Vietnam, as well as the super typhoon Gaemi which swept across Taiwan and Fujian. Thankfully, Hong Kong was not negatively affected apart from monsoons and thundery showers.
As for this weekend, an anticyclone aloft is predicted to bring weather that is fine but persistently very hot, lasting over the weekend to the middle of next week. There isnâ€™t expected to be much wind, so donâ€™t forget your portable fans!

author: Addison Perry
title: Discoveries in Oncology: Ascentage Pharma's Path Forward
text:
Discoveries in Oncology: Ascentage Pharma's Path Forward
Addison PerryUpdated: 04-23-2025 07:15 PM
Exciting Developments from Ascentage Pharma Presentations
Ascentage Pharma, a leading biopharmaceutical firm, recently announced significant progress in their clinical studies, particularly focusing on innovative cancer treatments. At the upcoming ASCO Annual Meeting, the company plans to showcase findings related to their two prominent drug candidates: lisaftoclax and alrizomadlin. These therapies are specifically designed to target hematological malignancies, addressing critical gaps in current treatment options.
A Closer Look at Key Clinical Studies
The oral presentations at the conference will emphasize the results of a Phase Ib/II study evaluating the combination of lisaftoclax with azacitidine for patients who are either treatment-naÃ¯ve or have previously been exposed to venetoclax. This combination could open groundbreaking avenues for treating myeloid malignancies.
Pioneering Research in Hematological Malignancies
The featured Phase 1b/2 study will highlight the effectiveness of the combination therapy within a significant session dedicated to hematologic malignancies. Ascentage Pharmaâ€™s commitment to addressing these severe conditions has led to substantial advances in therapeutic approaches available to physicians.
Global Impact of ASCO Annual Meeting
The ASCO Annual Meeting represents a vital platform for healthcare professionals worldwide. It attracts over 40,000 oncology specialists and focuses on advancing the science of cancer treatment. Representing Ascentage Pharma at this yearâ€™s conference will be esteemed medical professionals committed to innovating cancer therapies.
Dr. Yifan Zhai's Insights
Dr. Yifan Zhai, the Chief Medical Officer of Ascentage Pharma, expressed pride in attending this major oncology event for the eighth consecutive year. His enthusiastic remarks underscored the importance of sharing innovative data concerning therapies such as lisaftoclax and alrizomadlin, both of which are under rigorous clinical investigation to enhance treatment options for patients worldwide.
Details on Clinical Studies Being Presented
During this yearâ€™s conference, specific studies including:
- Phase 1b/2 study of lisaftoclax combined with azacitidine: This study aims to provide vital insights into treatment-naÃ¯ve or previously exposed patients to venetoclax, with results shared as part of an oral presentation.
- Phase 2 study of alrizomadlin: This study investigates the MDM2 inhibitor, both standalone and in conjunction with toripalimab, focusing on its effectiveness in treating patients with advanced adenoid cystic carcinoma or other solid tumors.
Ascentage Pharma has outlined a clear dedication to furthering research in these fields. Their lead drug candidates showcase a pioneering spirit in confronting some of the toughest medical challenges faced today.
Company Overview and Commitment to Innovation
Founded on the principle of addressing unmet medical needs, Ascentage Pharma is committed to developing groundbreaking therapies targeting key regulatory pathways in cell death and survival. This dual focus not only enhances their own pipeline but sets a foundation for industry-wide advancements in oncology.
With a robust portfolio comprising various innovative drug candidates, including inhibitors of Bcl-2 and MDM2-p53, Ascentage Pharma's mission extends beyond research, aiming to commercialize effective therapies widely accessible to patients.
Strategic Collaborations and Achievements
Ascentage Pharma has built strategic partnerships with prominent biotech and pharmaceutical firms while also engaging with key academic institutions, fostering collaborative efforts that underscore their commitment to advancing cancer research and therapy development.
In recent developments, their lead asset, Olverembatinib, has secured approval in China, bolstering their presence in the market. Additionally, the company is working diligently on the NDA for lisaftoclax, showing significant progress in the path to gaining regulatory approvals.
Looking Ahead at Future Prospects
Ascentage Pharma aims to continuously enhance its research and development capabilities while expanding its intellectual property portfolio. The firm is dedicated to providing innovative solutions that not only address current medical challenges but also pave the way for future advancements.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are the key presentations by Ascentage Pharma at ASCO?
Ascentage Pharma will present data on their drug candidates, lisaftoclax and alrizomadlin, focusing on their effectiveness in treating various cancers.
Who is Dr. Yifan Zhai?
Dr. Yifan Zhai is the Chief Medical Officer at Ascentage Pharma, who will share insights on the company's research and innovative developments during the ASCO Annual Meeting.
What is the focus of Ascentage Pharma's research?
The company primarily targets hematological malignancies and is developing therapies that address critical needs in cancer treatments.
Are lisaftoclax and alrizomadlin approved therapies?
No, both lisaftoclax and alrizomadlin are investigational drugs currently undergoing clinical trials and have not yet received regulatory approval.
How does Ascentage Pharma collaborate with other organizations?
The company has established partnerships with leading biopharmaceutical firms and research institutions to advance its clinical development and innovation efforts.

author: Emily Arseneau
title: Colorado mother wanted for murder of two children, third child injured
text:
Colorado mother wanted for murder of two children, third child injured
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (KRDO) - The Colorado Springs Police Department (CSPD) is asking for help locating a mother accused of killing two of her children and injuring another.
CSPD responded to a burglary call in the 5300 block of Palomino Ranch Point on Dec. 19.
Once on the scene, CSPD says that officers found an adult female and an 11-year-old female who had sustained injuries. Two other juveniles, a 9-year-old girl and a 7-year-old boy, were found deceased in the residence.
Previous coverage: Death investigation underway after two people were found dead at an apartment complex
Police identified the adult female as 35-year-old Kimberlee Singler, who is the mother of all three children in the residence.
CSPD says that Singler and her 11-year-old daughter were treated for their injuries on the scene by the Colorado Springs Fire Department and American Medical Response prior to being transported to local hospitals for further medical treatment.
The Colorado Springs Police Department Homicide Unit responded to the scene and assumed the investigation.
As the investigation into this case unfolded police say it was determined the initial report of a burglary was unfounded.
On Dec. 26, investigators established probable cause and obtained an arrest warrant for Kimberlee Singler on the following charges.
- 2 counts â€“ 18-3-102(1)(a), Murder in the First Degree, Class One Felony (F1)
- 2 counts â€“ 18-3-102(1)(f), Murder in the First Degree, Class One Felony (F1)
- 1 count â€“ 18-2-101, Criminal Attempt â€“ Murder in the First Degree (18-3-102(1)(a)), Class Two Felony (F2)
- 1 count â€“ 18-2-101, Criminal Attempt â€“ Murder in the First Degree (18-3-102(1)(f)), Class Two Felony (F2)
- 2 counts â€“ 18-6-401(7)(a)(i), Child Abuse, Class Two Felony (F2)
- 1 count â€“ 18-6-401(7)(a)(iii), Child Abuse, Class Three Felony (F3)
- 1 count â€“ 18-3-202, Assault in the First Degree, Class Three Felony (F3)
CSPD says that a $10,000,000 bond was set by the court. The details of the arrest warrant are currently sealed under court order and are expected to be unsealed at a later time.
When the warrant was issued, CSPDâ€™s Violent Offender Fugitive Task Force began efforts to locate Ms. Singler to apprehend her. She was last seen on Saturday, December 23, 2023, and her current whereabouts are unknown.
This is an active investigation, and anyone with information or who is a witness to this investigation is asked to call the Colorado Springs Police Department at (719) 444-7000; or if you wish to remain anonymous, you may call the Crime Stoppers Tip Line at (719) 634-STOP (7867) or 1-800-222-8477.
